newsitem.title: INDIA: India Reliance Ind hikes PVC capacity.
newsitem.headline: India Reliance Ind hikes PVC capacity.

text.p: Indian petrochemicals firm Reliance Industries said it raised its polyvinyl chloride (PVC) capacity to 270,000 tonnes a year from 180,000 tonnes at the weekend.
"The PVC plant based on Geon technology will be expanded further to 300,000 tonnes per annum," it said in a statement on Monday.
The PVC plant is part of Reliance's second petrochemical complex at Hazira on the western coast.

"Historically, the demand growth in India at 12 percent has far outpaced the global demand growth at 4.0 percent," it said. "With a host of new application areas for PVC that are yet to be fully exploited, the growth prospects are tremendous," it said.
It said Reliance expected a market share of about 42 to 45 percent in the Indian PVC market.
"The PVC plant will shortly be integrated with ethylene, a raw material for PVC, becoming available from Reliance's own 750,000 tonnes per annum multi-feed cracker," Reliance said.
It said PVC global prices are around $650-$700 per tonne.
Reliance is India's largest private firm.
